title: Trump informed that he is target of investigation over classified docs: Sources
description: Trump has received a letter from special counsel Jack Smith that he is the target of an investigation relating to his handling of classified information, sources said

title: Tour spots at least 20 killer whales off San Francisco
description: Roughly two dozen killer whales were spotted last month off the coast of San Francisco in an uncommonly large grouping of orcas for Northern California

title: Ex-Florida State football player acquitted in fatal shooting
description: A South Florida jury has agreed that a former Florida State football player acted in self-defense when he fatally shot one man and injured another several hours after he scuffled with his girlfriend

title: Actor Jay Johnston, known for 'Bob's Burgers' character, arrested on Capitol riot charges
description: An actor known for his roles on the comedy television shows “Bob’s Burgers” and “Mr. Show with Bob and David” has been arrested on charges that he joined a mob of Donald Trump supporters in confronting police officers during the U.S. Capitol riot

title: Lionel Messi picks MLS's Inter Miami in a move that stuns soccer after exit from Paris Saint-Germain
description: Lionel Messi says he is coming to Inter Miami and joining Major League Soccer

title: WATCH:  Timelapse: Canadian wildfire smoke envelops New York City
description: Eerie timelapse condenses 45 minutes into 45 seconds, showing smoke from the ongoing Canadian wildfires overwhelming New York City, darkening the skies and obscuring buildings.

title: Minibus crash kills 25 people, including nine children, in northern Afghanistan
description: An Afghan police spokesman says 25 people, including nine children, have died in a minibus accident in the country's north

title: Supreme Court justices release new financial disclosures – but not for Thomas, Alito
description: A fresh batch of financial records for justices of the U.S. Supreme Court was published by the federal judiciary on Wednesday,

title: Missouri governor signs bill banning gender-affirming care for transgender minors, some adults
description: Transgender minors and some adults soon will be banned from accessing puberty blockers, hormones and gender-affirming surgeries under a bill signed by Missouri’s Republican governor

title: George Winston, million-selling pianist known for his melodic style, dead at age 73
description: Grammy-winning pianist George Winston has died

title: Man wanted in triple homicide is captured in Philadelphia; victims include 2 children
description: A fugitive wanted in the fatal shooting of three people, including two children who’d been playing with kittens in the backyard of their Pennsylvania home, has been captured in Philadelphia

title: Iowa Gov. Reynolds asks White House for help after partial building collapse
description: Gov. Kim Reynolds has asked the White House for reimbursement for the response to a partially collapsed building in Davenport, Iowa, and assistance with the demolition of the remaining structure

title: Questions remain over the disappearance of FBI informant in Russia
description: Wall Street Journal reporter Brett Forrest spoke with ABC News Live about his new book that looks at the disappearance of Billy Reilly.

title: Prince Harry to tabloid newspaper's lawyer: 'Nobody wants to be phone hacked'
description: Prince Harry has rejected a suggestion that a lack of evidence meant his phone wasn’t hacked by reporters for Mirror Group Newspapers

title: BBC, British Airways among big-name victims in MOVEit software hack
description: Britain’s cybersecurity agency has urged companies to be vigilant after the BBC, British Airways and other firms said their employees’ personal details may have been compromised in a software hack

title: CNN Chairman and CEO Chris Licht steps down
description: Licht served as CEO for 13 months.

title: NYC goes after Hyundai, Kia after security flaw leads to wave of theft
description: New York City has filed a lawsuit against Hyundai and Kia, claiming that the automakers’ vehicles are too susceptible to theft

title: Japan supports Sweden's NATO membership as defense ministers strengthen ties
description: Japan’s defense minister has expressed his country’s support for Sweden’s NATO membership during talks with his Swedish counterpart

title: White woman who fatally shot Black neighbor is arrested in Florida
description: The Marion County Sheriff’s Office says a Florida woman accused of fatally shooting her neighbor last week in the violent culmination of what the sheriff described as a 2½-year feud was arrested Tuesday

title: Former ByteDance exec: Chinese Communist Party tracked Hong Kong protesters via data
description: A former executive at ByteDance, the Chinese company which owns the popular short-video app TikTok, says in a legal filing that some members of the ruling Communist Party used data held by the company to identify and locate protesters in Hong Kong

title: WATCH:  Volunteers rescue cats and dogs from flooded Ukrainian city
description: A major breach at a dam near Kherson has devastated nearby communities.

title: Turkish lira declines to record lows following start of Erdogan's new term
description: The Turkish lira has tumbled to fresh record lows, extending its slide against the U.S. dollar

title: Spain registers hottest spring temperatures on record
description: Spain registered its hottest spring on record this year, and its second driest ever, the state meteorological agency says

title: NATO allies prepare unprecedented air deployment exercise over Europe
description: Germany is preparing to host the biggest air deployment exercise in NATO’s history

title: Could Ozempic help curb addictive behaviors?
description: Semaglutide and other drugs in its class are widely known for their role in managing type 2 diabetes and suppressing appetite.

title: Mike Pence announces he's challenging Trump in 2024 presidential race
description: Mike Pence will kick off his presidential campaign on Wednesday from Iowa, an early-voting state Trump won in 2016 and 2020

title: Pope Francis to have intestinal surgery in Rome
description: Pope Francis will undergo an intestinal surgery on Wednesday and spend several days in the hospital recovering.

title: Canadian wildfire smoke updates: East Coast skies engulfed in dangerous haze
description: Heavy smoke from Canadian wildfires is engulfing the East Coast, creating serious health risks for millions.

title: 2 dead, 5 injured after shooting following high school graduation
description: Seven people were shot following a high school graduation in Richmond, Virginia, on Tuesday, police said.

title: WATCH:  Deer goes for a dip in New Jersey swimming pool
description: A New Jersey resident captured footage of the moment a deer dove into a swimming pool. Animal control officers report the deer appeared to be in fine shape and was released.

title: Artist Françoise Gilot, acclaimed painter, dead at 101
description: Françoise Gilot, a prolific painter who was nonetheless more famous for her turbulent relationship with Pablo Picasso — and for leaving him — died on Tuesday in Manhattan
